content: I'm working on preparing for interviews for my post-Mozilla career. Part of that is making sure I can talk about projects I was involved with - which includes the Rust infra team. I'm reviewing the forge docs and filling in what I know, but I'm going to post questions here as I come to them (no rush in responding! this isn't urgent!)
first question - what are some examples of infrastructure that we use the bastion host to log into?
we currently use the bastion to log into all our ec2 instances, and to access the rds database
or really, anything inside the privatesubnet of the vpc
ty! I notice it's used for connecting to crater hosts as well
uh yeah, for those we just whitelist only the bastion server for the ssh port
it's useful to use it for non-aws stuff because we have an audit trail coming off the bastion server

Pietro Albini said:

or really, anything inside the privatesubnet of the vpc

yeah, docs.rs uses it too
